sense.def:
Kadar je nekdo ali nekaj
free
, ni nadzorovan ali omejen.

seg.quote: Within the EEC there is free movement of labour.

sense.def:
Kdor je
free
, ni več zapornik ali suženj.

seg.quote: I wish to return to London, this time as a free man.
One prisoner in seven had been set free.

sense.def:
To free a prisoner or a slave
pomeni spustiti zapornika ali sužnja na prostost.

seg.quote: She was arrested but freed after three weeks.

sense.def:
To free someone of something unpleasant or restricting
pomeni osvoboditi nekoga nečesa neprijetnega ali omejujočega.

seg.quote: ...the attempt to free France of the Dictator.

sense.def:
To be free of something unpleasant
pomeni, da nekdo ali nekaj nima nečesa neprijetnega ali to nanj ne vpliva.

seg.quote: The area will be free of pollution by the year 2000.

sense.def:
To free something
pomeni narediti nekaj, na primer denar ali sredstva, dostopno za neko nalogo ali namen.

seg.quote: We could cut defence expenditure, freeing vital resources for more useful purposes.

sense.def:
To have a free period of time
ali
to be free at a particular time
pomeni, da ob določenem času nismo zaposleni.

seg.quote: They don't have much free time.

sense.def:
Kadar je prostor, sedež ali stroj
free
, ni zaseden ali v uporabi.

Kadar je nekaj
free
, tisto lahko imamo ali uporabimo, ne da bi za to plačali.

To cut or pull something free
pomeni nekaj premakniti tako, da ni več pritrjeno ali ujeto.

seg.quote: I shook my jacket free and hurried off.

sense.def:
To free something
pomeni osvoboditi nekaj, kar je pritrjeno ali ujeto, in odstraniti s kraja, kjer je bilo.
